intro: Lupinus durangensis, commonly known as the Durango lupine, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit and clusters of pea-like flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant has feathery, compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Lupinus durangensis is a member of the legume family and has the ability to fix nitrogen, making it ecologically significant in its habitat.
